website_summaries.verdict: The Order: 1886 is a beautiful and impressive technical achievement, but it's also chock-full of frustrating control issues. Odd pacing and a less than compelling storyline don't help either.
pros: The Order: 1886 is one of the best looking games around
Its fantastic dramatic performances are matched with a beautifully realized alternate vision of Victorian London
cons: There are some frustrating issues with The Order's controls and the game's lengthy cutscenes and breaks in the action are jarring

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: While I understand the complaints some have of the game being short and it not being open world, I sincerely appreciated the beauty of the atmosphere and the story. Its a gorgeous game and being a fan of steampunk and the Victorian London era, I absolutely loved the game. The story is so well executed and the voice acting is one of my favorites, standing right alongside the acting in The Last of Us. If you're looking for a shooter game with constant obstacles, then this is not the game for you but if you would like to enjoy a well thought out story with believable characters than I highly recommend The Order 1886.

Maybe it's worth it if you're really deep into steampunk, but other than that you'd probably give this one a miss.

customer_reviews.title: The best worst game ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Everything good about the game has an equal bad point: Impressive visuals and a great looking world are never explored beyond being on a rail the whole time. Great voice acting and sound wrap around a low budget and paper thin story. Somewhat inventive weapons fall pray to a dull cover shooter, making using them boring. Plus! Stupid QTEs all the time! Awful stealth segments! Unfinished story! Incredibly short! No replay value! I don't like giving 1 or 5 stars unless they're deserved and while this game is not truly bad, it only receives a second star because I played it to completion.

This game is the must have for the gamer that is sick of the futuristic lights and fluff b.s. that Advanced Warfighter and Halo brought to gaming. customer_reviews.title: A half finished movie with some gallery shooting tossed in...
customer_reviews.text: I went in expecting a steam-punk inspired Gears of War and instead got a half finished movie with some gallery shooting tossed in. If a sequel ever comes out, please consider giving the player some freedom. Simple things like open environments, multiple ways to approach an objective, and the ability to use all of the weapons you collect would go a long way towards making an engaging experience. Please trust me to operate your game without hand holding and strenuous restrictions. Also if you're going to do a movie-driven game, get better writers and don't end it on a cliff hanger.
